title: Q6 - Can a Data Principal sue a Consent Manager directly if it mishandles their consents?
description: Under the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 (DPDPA), a Data Principal cannot directly "sue" a Consent Manager in court in the first instance.

previous.title: Q5 - How does a Consent Manager ensure that a withdrawal of consent is reflected immediately across all organizations using that consent?

next.title: Q7 - How does DPDPA ensure neutrality of Consent Managers so they do not secretly favor large corporations?
